snippet: Lucille Barchitta and her friends describe what it was like to be part of the scene in “Here Lies Love,” a disco-musical that belongs to a rising wave of theater in which the audience joins the show.
abstract: Lucille Barchitta and her friends describe what it was like to be part of the scene in Here Lies Love, a disco-musical that belongs to a rising wave of theater in which the audience joins the show; some view participatory theater as a new egalitarian phase in the actor-audience relationship; others promote it as a rescue for theaters in dire financial straits.
lead_paragraph: Lucille Barchitta and her friends describe what it was like to be part of the scene in “Here Lies Love,” a disco-musical that belongs to a rising wave of theater in which the audience joins the show.

headline.seo: ‘Here Lies Love’ and the Era of Audience Participation
